prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0065] Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane (face_1) of the coordinate system: 1. Create Line 1: - Start Point: [0.0, 0.0] - End Point: [0.0, 0.194] 2. Create Line 2: - Start Point: [0.0, 0.194] - End Point: [0.0, 0.3879] 3. Create Line 3: - Start Point: [0.0, 0.3879] - End Point: [0.75, 0.3879] 4. Create Line 4: - Start Point: [0.75, 0.3879] - End Point: [0.75, 0.0] 5. Create Line 5: - Start Point: [0.75, 0.0] - End Point: [0.0, 0.0] Create a circle (loop_2.circle_1) with a center point at [0.194, 0.194] and a radius of 0.0013. Close the loop for loop_1. It has 5 lines. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis (the normal direction) with a depth of 0.0065 (extrude_depth_opposite_normal). Scale the sketch by 0.75 (sketch_scale). This constitutes the first part of the CAD model, a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height, width, and length are: - Height: 0.0065 - Width: 0.75 - Length: 0.75</description>

Proceed with line 6 from the point (0.45, 0.4245) to the point (0.45, 0.462). 2.7. Connect line 6 to the starting point (0.0375, 0.462) with line 7 of length 0.3312. 2.8. Scale the sketch by 0.75 in all directions using the "sketch_scale" parameter. 4. Extrude the scaled sketch vertically by 0.75 units, creating the 3D model. Part 2: Create a set of cylindrical objects with varying heights and diameters, arranged in different formations. 5. Create a new coordinate system with Euler Angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector of [0.0375, 0.0403, 0.0403]. Sketching the cylinders bases: 6.
